senses.de: To have enough money to buy or pay for something
senses.ex: I can't afford to buy a new car.

Tips.title: Financial Capability
Tips.description: Stress the aspect of having enough resources before making a purchase or commitment.
Tips.example: Even though it's on sale, I still can't afford that designer jacket.

Tips.title: Emotional Stress
Tips.description: Implies emotional stress or difficulty when saying what you can't buy or do.
Tips.example: I'd love to join you on vacation, but I just can't afford it right now.

Tips.title: Prioritizing Expenses
Tips.description: Helps in discussing budgeting priorities or financial planning.
Tips.example: We should prioritize our bills; we can't afford a new TV this month.

senses.de: To have enough time or ability for something
senses.ex: I can't afford to waste time on this.

Tips.title: Time Management
Tips.description: Highlights the importance of time allocation to activities.
Tips.example: We can't afford to delay our project submission any longer.

Tips.title: Opportunity Costs
Tips.description: Mentions what you might need to give up to do something else.
Tips.example: I can't afford to take a break; I might miss an important call.

Tips.title: Ability Implications
Tips.description: Implies whether something is within one's skill or capability to do.
Tips.example: Can you afford to edit the video by yourself, or should we hire someone?

senses.ex: The forest affords shelter to many animals.

Tips.title: Providing Resources
Tips.description: Relates to making resources available or accessible.
Tips.example: Our community center affords a safe space for teens to socialize.

Tips.title: Beyond Money
Tips.description: Shifts the focus from financial to other forms of provision.
Tips.example: These thick walls afford us protection from the cold winds.

Tips.title: Availability Indication
Tips.description: Suggests the presence or availability of something beneficial.
Tips.example: This program affords children the opportunity to learn a second language.

Allow.wordDefinition:
Allow is used when talking about permission or giving someone the ability to do something. For example, "My parents allow me to stay out until midnight." It means that your parents have given you permission to stay out until a certain time.

Afford is used when talking about having enough money or means to do something, while allow is used when talking about permission or giving someone the ability to do something.

Endure.wordDefinition:
Endure means to be able to handle or tolerate a difficult or unpleasant situation. For example, if you are able to withstand the pain of a strenuous workout, you can endure it.

Afford is applicable when you talk about your finances and whether you have enough money to buy something, while endure is applicable when you talk about your ability to tolerate or handle a difficult situation.

Grant.wordDefinition:
Grant is used when someone else gives us something either as a favor or as a reward for something we have done.

For example, a scholarship or a financial aid could be considered a grant because someone else is giving us the money to pay for school.

Afford means having enough money to pay for something on our own, while grant means someone else giving us something (usually money) for a specific purpose.

Offer.wordDefinition:
Offer means to present something for someone else to take or accept, such as a proposal, suggestion, or opportunity.

For example: "The company is offering a discount on their products."

So, while afford is used to talk about being able to pay for something, offer is used to talk about presenting something for others to take or accept.

Permit.wordDefinition:
Permit means that you have permission or allowance to do something. For example, "My parents permit me to stay up until midnight on weekends.".

Afford is about money, while permit is about permission.

Provide.wordDefinition:
Provide means to give or supply something that is needed or wanted. For example, "The restaurant will provide free water for their customers.".

Afford is used when talking about having enough money or resources, while provide is used when talking about giving or supplying something.

Sustain.wordDefinition:
Afford refers to the ability to pay for something, whereas sustain refers to the ability to keep something going or maintain it.

For example, you may be able to afford to buy a new phone, but you need to sustain it by keeping it charged and taking care of it.

In terms of more serious issues, a community may be able to afford to plant trees, but they need to sustain them by providing consistent care and support.

Afford refers to the ability to initiate something, while sustain refers to the ability to maintain it over time.

Withstand.wordDefinition:
Withstand means to endure or resist the force or pressure of something. For example, if a building can withstand an earthquake, it means the building can survive the shaking and remain standing without collapsing.

Both words are applicable in different situations. Afford is used when talking about finances and resources, while withstand is used when talking about strength and durability.

quotes.Text: It has been my aim throughout present operations to afford the greatest amount of protection to life and property interests, and troops have been stationed accordingly.
quotes.Title: American Soldier
quotes.Name: George Crook

quotes.Text: When a man is tired of London, he is tired of life; for there is in London all that life can afford.
quotes.Title: English Writer
quotes.Name: Samuel Johnson

quotes.Text: I always encourage over-tipping if you can afford it because... share the wealth.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Zach Braff

quotes.Text: Not too many people can afford for the wife to stay home and raise the kids.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Eric Braeden

quotes.Text: I definitely want to help the youth, people who can't afford medicine.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Redman

quotes.Text: We cannot afford to lose the Medicaid funding for low-income women.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Kay Bailey Hutchison

quotes.Text: You can't afford to be afraid of failure in this business.
quotes.Title: Indian Director
quotes.Name: Vikram Bhatt

quotes.Text: All my life, I've had restaurants that were affordable.
quotes.Title: Spanish Chef
quotes.Name: Jose Andres

quotes.Text: You can't afford to live your life with regrets.
quotes.Title: Australian Athlete
quotes.Name: Shane Warne

quotes.Text: The world cannot afford a nuclear Iran.
quotes.Title: Israeli Politician
quotes.Name: Tzipi Livni
